description: Medical diagnosis and risk assessment involves evaluating a patient's health to identify potential diseases or conditions and assessing the risk of future health issues. This is crucial for timely intervention and effective treatment planning.
you_have_this_if: You are dealing with patients who have non-ischemic cardiomyopathy (NICM).
You need to assess arrhythmia risk without invasive procedures.
You are looking to predict arrhythmogenic substrates.
You are developing tools for cardiac health monitoring.
You require statistical methods for accurate diagnosis.

approaches.best_for: when you need a non-invasive method to assess arrhythmia risk in NICM patients.
approaches.key_tradeoff: SAECG provides non-invasive assessment but may have limitations in specificity.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to evaluate arrhythmia risk in patients without invasive procedures.

start_here: Start with Signal Averaged Electrocardiography (SAECG) as it provides a reliable non-invasive assessment for arrhythmia risk in NICM patients.
